intro: Oldfieldia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited oldfieldia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oldfieldia macrocarpa thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
